title: Can I get an MBBS seat with 120 marks on the NEET? - Quora
tags: Bachelor of Medicine and Bachelor of Surgery Exams
Bachelor of Medicine and Bachelor of Surgery Degrees

response.answer_text: May be or May be not . Because for the General Catagory students the NEET cut off percentile is 50th percentile. This is not percentage this is percentile .And 50 percentile means u have to rank in between 50 percent candidates of total candidates .For exam if total 12 lakh students wrote the NEET exam than u have to rank in between 6 lakh for qualifying . And the qualifying lowest marks for general Catagory is 134. And for ST ,SC and OBC it is 40th percentile .That means qualifying marks is 119–107 for these reserved Catagory . So if u r from General Category u can not get a seat for MBBS with 120 marks . But if you are from ST,SC than u may can get a seat for M.B.B.S with 120 marks . I think u got your answer . But If U have any quaries then Massage me .
Yes you can…! If you've scored 120 in physics, 120 in chemistry and approx 240–260 in biology, there's a chance for you to get a seat in a government college in less competitive state. Good luck

Thanks for asking A2A First of all i would like to congratulate you for ur marks..you will definitely get MBBS seat if your father owns a college or if your chacha is a vidhayak.. All the best for your future..
No with these marks u are not even eligible for selection rather u haven't passed only If u do not score 50% marks
First you have necessity to qualify the exam. Every year qualification marks are different. Previous year it was 115 for reserved category and 145 for general.
No u cnnt get mbbs seat easily by 1w0 marks on neet bt if ur frm sc’s and st’s u may get it
